byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Wisconsin Gov Scott Walker is poised to sign measure that would bar labor unions from requiring private-sector workers to pay equivalent of dues; bill is being fast-tracked through Republican-controlled State Legislature; move has positive reverberations for Walker, who is readying presidential run on his attempt to challenge unions in 2011.
lead_paragraph: A measure being fast-tracked through the Republican-held State Legislature would bar unions from requiring workers to pay the equivalent of dues.

headline.main: Scott Walker Is Set to Deliver New Blow to Labor in Wisconsin
headline.print_headline: Walker Is Set to Deliver New Blow to Labor and Bolster Credentials

snippet: A measure being fast-tracked through the Republican-held State Legislature would bar unions from requiring workers to pay the equivalent of dues.
